did.abstract: Collection comprises 175 Turkish political posters, including three duplicates. There are seven series of posters: Korean War, NATO, Historical significance, Commemoration of Ottoman historical figures, Republican-era historical figures, Leftist, and Presidency of the Turkish Republic. In the first, sixteen posters extoll the achievements of the Turkish Armed Forces command or Turkish Brigade in the Korean War between November 1950 and July 1953. In the second series, one poster represents Turkey's relationship to North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), and another reflects the naval and air force maneuvers of NATO's Southern Command, Greece, and Turkey at Weld Fast in 1953. The third series includes 26 posters that celebrate events of historic national significance and depict international political figures together with Turkish leaders. The fourth series includes four posters that commemorate Ottoman historical figures, including admiral Barbaros Hayrettin, and sultans Mehmet V, Mehmed II, and Selim I. The fifth series includes 14 posters of Repulican-era historical figures, including portraits of World War II generals and political figures. The sixth series contains 63 leftist political posters with political slogans, as well as calls for meetings and demonstrations; most of them date from the second half of the 1970's. The seventh series contains 50 posters issued by the Presidency of the Turkish Republic regarding the failed coup attempt of 15 July 2016.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises 175 Turkish political posters, including three duplicates. There are seven series of posters: Korean War, NATO, Historical significance, Commemoration of Ottoman historical figures, Republican-era historical figures, Leftist, and Presidency of the Turkish Republic (which features posters issued following the failed 2016 coup).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sixteen posters, including 2 duplicates, extoll the achievements of the Turkish Armed Forces command or Turkish Brigade in the Korean War between November 1950 and July 1953. These posters show battle scenes and portraits of Brigadier General Tahzin Yazıcı and assistant Brigade commander Celâl Dora. Another shows an American officer, General Walker, decorating Yazıcı with the Silver Star. Ten of these posters are signed by graphic artists, including M. Işık, Cemal Baki, M. Baki, and Mehmet Tekdal; the remainder are unsigned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One poster represents Turkey's relationship to North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), and another reflects the naval and air force maneuvers of NATO's Southern Command, Greece, and Turkey at Weld Fast in 1953, which were designed to test the training and co-operation of their forces. Individuals represented in the second poster include military leaders Nurettin Baransel, Willard G. Wyman, Stylianos Kitrilakis, and Alezandros Karadimitropoulos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Twenty-six posters celebrate events of historic national significance and depict international political figures together with Turkish leaders. Within the series, there are seven posters celebrating the annexation of Hatay State into Turkey as Hatay province, one depicting Atatürk and Mustafa İsmet İnönü on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the Revolution, one showing U.S. President Dwight Eisenhower shaking hands with Celâl Bayar, and another image of Winston Churchill shaking hands with İnönü. Other posters depict women's support of the army and British-Turkish relations. Within this series, 19 posters are signed by artist Mehmet Bakı (some M. Bakı); the others are not signed.

did.unittitle: Commemoration of Ottoman Historical Figures Series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four posters commemorate Ottoman historical figures, including admiral Barbaros Hayrettin, and sultans Mehmet V, Mehmed II, and Selim I.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fourteen posters of Repulican-era historical figures, including portraits of World War II generals, Greek war, and political figures such as Atatürk (five posters), İnönü (five posters), Fevzi Çakmak (three posters), Salih Omurtag, and Kazim Orbay. Within this series, 11 posters are signed by artist Mehmet Bakı (some M. Bakı); the others are not signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sixty-three leftist political posters (plus one duplicate) with political slogans, as well as calls for meetings and demonstrations. Most date from the second half of the 1970's, a period when the political climate was influenced by inflation, unemployment, and political violence. The slogans attack "fascist" and capitalist politics and denounce poverty. One poster contains a portrait of the Luis Corvalá́n, the former general secretary of the Communist party of Chile. Three others promote "Health Week 1977," which was organized by the Istanbul Tabip Odasi (Istanbul Medical Chamber). Political organizations named on the posters include, but are not limited to, Türkiye Isçi Partisi, Türkiye Sosyalist Isçi Partisi (TSIP), Türkiye Sağlık Işçileri Sendikası. One poster shows a portrait of Ibrahim Kaypakkaya, a well-known political prisoner active in the Communist movement, together with a portrait of of Aşık Emekçi, a singer. In this series symbols such as raised fists, fists smashing a svastika, broken chains, and silhouettes of workers' faces abound.

did.unittitle: Presidency of the Turkish Republic Series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 50 posters issued by the Presidency of the Turkish Republic regarding 15 Temmuz, the failed coup d'etat attempt of 15 July 2016. The posters all feature the same theme, "respect our destiny and our soldiers," and feature two sizes, 39 x 22.5-inches (but untrimmed) and 28 x 39-inches. One is extra large at 39 x 78-inches.
